1.segment: SIMPLE SUMMARY : Hepatoblastoma is the most common malignant pediatric tumor of the liver .

2.segment: Unlike hepatocellular carcinoma ( HCC ) which has been associated with hepatitis B virus infection or cirrhosis ,

3.segment: the etiology of hepatoblastoma remains vague .

4.segment: Genetic syndromes , including familial adenomatous polyposis ( FAP ) ,

6.segment: and trisomy 18 syndrome , have been associated with hepatoblastoma .

7.segment: BWS is an overgrowth syndrome which exhibits an alteration of genomic imprinting on chromosome 11p15 .5 .

8.segment: N ( 6 ) - Methyladenosine ( M ( 6 ) A ) is an RNA modification with rampant involvement in the metabolism of cells and malignant diseases .

9.segment: It has been observed to impact the development of various cancers via its governance of gene expression .

10.segment: Here , we explore the role of m ( 6 ) A and its genetic associates in promoting HB ,

11.segment: and the impact this may have on our future management of the disease .

12.segment: ABSTRACT : Hepatoblastoma ( HB ) is a rare primary malignancy of the developing fetal liver .

13.segment: Its course is profoundly influenced by genetics ,

14.segment: in the context of sporadic mutation or genetic syndromes .

15.segment: Conventionally , subtypes of HB are histologically determined based on the tissue type that is recapitulated by the tumor and the direction of its differentiation .

16.segment: This classification is being reevaluated based on advances on molecular pathology .

17.segment: The therapeutic approach comprises surgical intervention ,

18.segment: chemotherapy ( in a neoadjuvant or post-operative capacity ) ,

19.segment: and in some cases , liver transplantation .

20.segment: Although diagnostic modalities and treatment options are evolving ,

21.segment: some patients experience complications , including relapse ,

22.segment: metastatic spread , and suboptimal response to chemotherapy .

23.segment: As yet , there is no consistent framework with which such outcomes can be predicted .

24.segment: N ( 6 ) - methyladenosine ( m ( 6 ) A ) is an RNA modification with rampant involvement in the normal processing of cell metabolism and neoplasia .

25.segment: It has been observed to impact the development of a variety of cancers via its governance of gene expression .

26.segment: M ( 6 ) A-associated genes appear prominently in HB .

27.segment: Literature data seem to underscore the role of m ( 6 ) A in promotion and clinical course of HB .

28.segment: Illuminating the pathogenetic mechanisms that drive HB are promising additions to the understanding of the clinically aggressive tumor behavior ,

29.segment: given its potential to predict disease course and response to therapy .

30.segment: Implicated genes may also act as targets to facilitate the evolving personalized cancer therapy .

31.segment: Here , we explore the role of m ( 6 ) A and its genetic associates in the promotion of HB ,

32.segment: and the impact this may have on the management of this neoplastic disease .
